article.headline: Saint Mary's 85, Binghamton 57
article.story: MORAGA, Calif. -- Mickey McConnell matched his career high with 24 points, freshman Matthew Dellavedova added 19 and Saint Mary's tied its season high for 3-pointers while beating Binghamton 85-57 in the Shamrock Office Solutions Classic on Monday night. Omar Samhan added 15 points and nine rebounds for the Gaels (12-2), becoming the sixth player in school history to top the 1,400-point plateau. McConnell and Dellavedova had five 3-pointers apiece while Saint Mary's made 13 as a team. The Gaels also had 13 3s against San Diego State on Nov. 16. Greer Wright scored 15 points to lead Binghamton (4-9), which has lost four of its last five.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
